verb.description: (with reference to a solid) become or cause to become incorporated into a liquid so as to form a solution.
examples: dissolve a bouillon cube in a pint of hot water

verb.description: Close down or dismiss (an assembly or official body)
examples: the country's president can dissolve parliament under certain circumstances

noun.description: (in a movie) an act or instance of moving gradually from one picture to another.

origin: Late Middle English (also in the sense break down into component parts): from Latin dissolvere, from dis- apart + solvere loosen or solve.
